bioghist.p: Donald Grey Brownlow (1923-2006) was a history teacher and author. He served in U.S. military intelligence during World War II and earned a Purple Heart and Bronze Star. He was also awarded the Croix de Guerre from the French government. He earned bachelor's and master's degrees from the University of Pennsylvania. He taught at the Haverford School from 1951-2006 and authored 10 books on military history, including Checkmate at Ruweisat: Auchinleckâ€™s Finest Hour (1977) and The Life and Times of Horst Wessel (1996).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of correspondence and interviews recorded by Donald Brownlow. The collection contains recordings of interviews and conversations with eminent people, including Grossadmiral Karl Donitz, Jean Paul Sartre, Admiral Husband E. Kimmel, Field Marshal Sir Claude Auchinleck, Otto von Bulow, and Albert Speer. The collection also contains over 1500 signed letters, whose correspondents include Captain Eddie Rickenbacker, Herbert Hoover, Eleanor Roosevelt, Stirling Moss, John L. Lewis, Hasso von Manteuffel, Captain P.C. Crosley, and Richard O'Connor, among many other state, military leaders, and public figures. A number of the letters are addressed to Dr. and Mrs. Marion Brownlow or to Marion Brownlow. Most of the letters are arranged in a series of 31 scrapbooks, dating from 1959 to 1972. There is also a card file index of the correspondence in the scrapbooks, listing sender, date, and a brief description of the letter's contents; photographs of German, British and American military figures and politicians; scrapbooks of photos and clippings on Leni Riefenstahl; a scrapbook of correspondence, pamphlets, clippings, and photographs of Gus Hall; drafts of chapters of Brownlow's book on Auchenleck (The Auk), and corrections and suggestions by Lt. Gen. Sir Neil Ritchie.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
